subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A new gadget?
author: Frank Ratka
full_text:
--0-100293801-1190908974=:18443
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Okay, its just an inexpensive EM meter. The ELF/VLF detection range posses =
a problem in that it will detect human speech and giving false positives. I=
 haven't been able to find a spec sheet or the manufacturer (K-II Enterpris=
es) to get one. Also, it shows in some of the product reviews that it gives=
 false readings if moved too quickly. 

What does one cost?

Regards,

Fran=
k R.

----- Original Message ----
From: Lynn burton <sunplex_chef@...=
>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, September 27, 2007 10:56:04 A=
M
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A new gadget?









  


    
            
 
  =
Hey Guys
      Here is the info taken straight off of the company's website=
.  I have to say that it is a very affordable meter and very rugged.  I am =
by no means a professional in this field, but I have to say that it is by f=
ar one of the most useful pieces I carry.  The company is K II (2) enterpri=
ses, I got mine off of ebay and had it in about 3 weeks do to back log in p=
roduction.  I hope this helps.
   
  Lynn
   
   
        
    
          
=
  
    
          
  
    
  Protect your family from harmful EMFs!   Measu=
re the EMF (Electro magnetic Field) strength of every electrical device in =
your home, workplace or school; outdoor power lines, underground lines and =
even when you travel and shop for appliances. Health concerns about the neg=
ative effects of ELECTRO MAGNETIC FIELDS (EMF) from appliances, power lines=
, and home wiring have caused the U.S. Government to issue a warning to use=
 "Prudent Avoidance" to help reduce your exposure to this risk.   Since EMF=
's are everywhere it may be impossible to totally avoid them.  The SAFE RAN=
GE EMF METER from K-II can help you measure these
 potentially harmful fiel=
ds and determine the safe range to help reduce exposure. It also helps you =
determine which appliances produce high level emissions.

        
  
    
=
  FEATURES INCLUDE:                
  
    
  Easy to read LED Display    
=
    
  50
 & 60 Hz operation    
    
  Five level milliGauss ranges    
  =
  
  For indoor and outdoor use     
    
  Durable plastic case          
=
  
  
    
  Operates for months on a single 9V battery  
    

    
  Dete=
cts the ELF range (50 to 1,000Hz) & VLF range (1,000 to 20,000Hz)

Frank Ra=
tka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:           I haven't "played" with one =
of these yet. What is the technology based on? What is it measuring to get =
the
 spikes?

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: Lynn =
burton <sunplex_chef@ yahoo.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Thursda=
y, September 27, 2007 10:35:32 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A new gadget?

   =
 
  Good morning all,
       
          Chris Fleming used one on the episo=
de about the Manson murders before.  I have had one for a while now, and le=
t me be the first to say that it works.  I have had numerous two way conver=
sations using it, as well as captured video evidence of these conversations=
 showing that there is nothing around capable of giving off an EMF.  The on=
ly issue that I have concern with is unlike EVP work or video ITC work you =
have no recognizable
 voice or image to positively correlate who the commun=
ication is coming from.  In my case, I might ask the question "Are you Sylv=
ia, my mother, show me two spikes for yes and one spike for no" and the met=
er will spike twice for yes, but I have no voice or image I would recognize=
 to verify that is who is causing the meter to spike.  The meter is a very =
useful tool and I do not conduct an investigation or session without it by =
my side, but like the rest of the tools in this field it has its valuable p=
oints as well as negative points. 
   
  Lynn 

Frank Sumption <franks-boxe=
s@ hotmail.com> wrote:
      
I saw on Ghost Hunters last night that they w=
ere using a "K2 Meter" to get yes-no answers from the unseen. I never heard=
 of that meter before. 
 
 Frank-S
